ranges.notes: New Year's Day (Jan 1) is a public holiday. Three Kings celebration (Jan 5-6) features a spectacular parade through central Granada and marks the main gift-giving tradition in Spain. January 6 is a public holiday.

Off-season with fewer tourists and excellent hotel value. Cold winter months but with frequent sunny days. Sierra Nevada ski resort at its peak season while the city enjoys mild winter days. Winter sales begin mid-January in all shops.
Winter continues with cold nights but often clear, sunny days. Good conditions for Sierra Nevada skiing combined with city visits.

San Cecilio, the patron saint of Granada, is celebrated on the first Sunday of February with pilgrimages to Sacromonte Abbey. Carnival celebrations feature costume parades and musical performances throughout the city, usually falling in late February or early March depending on the Easter calendar.
Early spring brings almond blossoms in the countryside around Granada and warming temperatures. Still excellent conditions for skiing in Sierra Nevada combined with city visits.

Spring officially begins with longer days and gardens starting to bloom. Ideal time for visiting the Alhambra gardens and Generalife as flowers begin appearing. Tourism gradually increases but still before peak season.

ranges.event: Semana Santa (Holy Week - varies by year)
ranges.notes: Granada's Holy Week processions feature solemn and haunting processions through the narrow streets of the historic center. The city's unique topography creates dramatic scenes as processions wind through the Albaicín and Centro districts.

Perfect spring weather with warm days and cool evenings. Ideal time to visit before summer crowds arrive. Sierra Nevada often still offers spring skiing while the city enjoys warm weather - a unique combination.
Public holiday with events throughout the city, many locals head to parks or the countryside for picnics

ranges.event: Día de la Cruz (Day of the Cross)
ranges.notes: One of Granada's most distinctive festivals (May 3), featuring flower-adorned crosses throughout the city with competitions between neighborhoods for the most beautiful displays. Plazas and patios are decorated, and music and festivities continue throughout the day and evening.

One of the best months to visit Granada with perfect temperatures, gardens in full bloom, and the Generalife at its most beautiful. The Alhambra's roses and other flowers create spectacular scenes. City comes alive with outdoor dining and activities.
Early summer brings warm days but still comfortable evenings. Tourism increases but still manageable. Outdoor dining and evening activities become particularly pleasant.

ranges.event: Corpus Christi & Festival Internacional de Música y Danza
ranges.notes: Corpus Christi brings religious processions and celebrations. The prestigious International Festival of Music and Dance begins in late June with performances in the Alhambra, Generalife, and other historic venues throughout the city, featuring world-class musicians and dancers.

ranges.event: Festival Internacional de Música y Danza
ranges.notes: The prestigious festival continues with performances in unique settings including the Palace of Charles V within the Alhambra and the Generalife Gardens. Hot daytime temperatures but pleasant evenings for performances.

Festival celebrating Granada's famous poet Federico García Lorca with performances, readings, and events in the gardens of his summer home, the Huerta de San Vicente. Very hot days but cool mountain evenings.

Public holiday on August 15 with religious observances. Peak summer season with very hot temperatures and maximum tourist numbers. Many locals leave the city for coastal areas. Night visits to the Alhambra particularly popular.

Hottest month of the year with temperatures often exceeding 36°C during the day. Tourism remains high with international visitors. Many local businesses may close for extended holiday periods. Evening activities most comfortable.

Excellent time to visit as summer crowds begin to diminish while weather remains warm during the day but more comfortable, especially in the evenings. Local life returns to normal rhythm after August holidays.
Autumn cultural events begin with concerts, exhibitions, and performances throughout the city. Perfect weather for exploring the Albaicín and other neighborhoods on foot.
Excellent autumn weather with warm days and cool evenings. Fall colors begin appearing in the parks and Sierra Nevada. Ideal conditions for hiking in surrounding mountains.
National holiday commemorating Columbus's arrival in the Americas, with events in various parts of the city.

Pleasant autumn with fewer tourists, excellent time for cultural activities and museum visits. The Alhambra is less crowded and surrounding gardens show beautiful fall colors. Sierra Nevada may receive first snowfall late in the month.
Public holiday with traditional cemetery visits and special services. Many businesses closed.

International jazz festival featuring performances at the Isabel la Católica Theater and venues throughout the city. Weather turns cooler with potential for first frosts and occasional rain. Sierra Nevada ski season may begin in late November.
Public holidays on December 6 (Constitution) and December 8 (Immaculate Conception) creating a 'puente' (bridge) holiday period for many Spaniards. Sierra Nevada ski season in full swing.

Granada's Christmas decorations and lights create a festive atmosphere. The traditional belén (nativity scene) displays appear throughout the city, with a large municipal belén in the Town Hall. Unique opportunity to combine skiing in Sierra Nevada with Christmas festivities in the city.
Public holiday with limited opening hours. Unlike northern Europe, December 26 is not a holiday in Spain.
Post-Christmas period with continued holiday atmosphere and festive decorations throughout the city. Sierra Nevada typically offers excellent skiing conditions during this period.
Celebrations throughout the city, particularly in Plaza del Carmen, with the tradition of eating 12 grapes at midnight. Many restaurants offer special New Year's dinners.

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism (or cold winter days)
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
